title: U.S. Military’s Boat Strikes Planning Takes On New Significance
summary: The details could raise questions about who was responsible for a follow-up strike on Sept. 2 — the commander who ordered it or the defense secretary.

title: The Furor Over Trump’s Boat Attacks and a Particular Follow-Up Strike, Explained
summary: Bipartisan congressional oversight is underway, but for now is focusing on narrow details about one missile instead of broader legal issues.

title: New York Times Sues Pentagon Over First Amendment Rights
summary: The lawsuit said the Defense Department’s new set of rules for journalists “violates the Constitution’s guarantees of due process, freedom of speech and freedom of the press.”

summary: Plus, the race to save music history.

title: Inside Kennedy’s Methodical Quest to Shake Up America’s Vaccine System
summary: The health secretary has walled himself off from government scientists and empowered fellow activists to pursue his vaccine agenda.

title: What Happens if Vaccines Aren’t Recommended?
summary: Advisers to Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. appear poised to make consequential changes to the childhood vaccination schedule. Apoorva Mandavilli, a science and global health reporter at The New York Times, explains how this change could affect vaccine accessibility.

title: Will All Newborns Still Receive Hepatitis B Shots? A Committee’s Vote Will Tell.
summary: The federal vaccine panel appointed by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is likely to decide on Thursday that the shots should be delayed for infants whose mothers test negative for the virus.

title: Hepatitis B Vaccine, Once a Public Health Win, Is Under Threat From RFK Jr.
summary: Rates of the disease have fallen since 1991, when all newborns began receiving the shot. An influential panel is scheduled to vote Thursday on eligibility for the vaccine.

title: Republican Anger Erupts at Johnson as Party Frets About Future
summary: A small group of G.O.P. women have been among the most vocal in raising what their colleagues say is a broader frustration with the speaker.

title: What Tennessee Revealed About the G.O.P.’s Trump Trap in the Midterms
summary: Republican candidates face the problem that President Trump alone gets out the vote that they need. And he alone gets out the vote that Democrats need, too.

title: A Volunteer’s Dire Warnings About the National Guard D.C. Shooting Suspect
summary: More than a year before the Trump administration granted asylum to the Afghan immigrant, the volunteer’s emails raised concerns that he was unraveling.

title: Afghan Refugees Face Uncertain Future As Trump Tightens Immigration Policy

summary: As Trump steps up his crackdown, our reporters explain what’s happening.

title: Best TV Shows of 2025
summary: Many of the year’s best series seemed to be in conversation with one another, including “Severance,” “The Pitt,” “Andor,” “Pluribus,” “The Lowdown” and others.

title: Trump to Host Congo and Rwanda Leaders for Peace Talks in Persistent Conflict
summary: The president will meet with the leaders of Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo to advance a deal meant to end a long war in eastern Congo.

summary: Workers installed the president’s name on the Washington institute, thrusting it back into the spotlight as it is set to host the signing of a peace deal between Rwanda and Congo.

summary: The president wanted Moscow and Kyiv to come to terms by Thanksgiving. Negotiations are now stalled, leaving the White House to decide if an agreement is possible anytime soon.

summary: Antonio Reynoso’s bid to replace Representative Nydia M. Velázquez will most likely be contested by a candidate backed by the Democratic Socialists of America.

title: Doctor Who Gave Matthew Perry Ketamine Is Sentenced to 30 Months
